page.title: 09St.Paul's Church at Flash
page.content:
On the outside it says that it was built in 1744 and it was rebuilt in 1901. A man called E.Y Ash built the pulpit. He carved apples and leaves on it and, hidden among the apples, there is a mouse. On a normal service there are only 10 people. However, if the church was full it would hold 200 people. The Beswick family gave the stained glass windows to Flash church. The church asks for money for a boy who is a spastic. He lives in Israel.
At the church they bury people and sometimes people get married and you go to the church to think about God and if you look at the windows there are pictures of God.
